conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a cutaway/isometric 3D model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, and multiple wall faces visible from an angled viewpoint.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion, readable interior volumes, angled view, and clean cutaway. Minor simplification/odd door geometry in a few openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room layout matches: living/dining left, kitchen central/top, bath+WC central/bottom, two bedrooms right, separate garage. Some mismatches/uncertainty around balcony representation and a few opening placements/sizes relative to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen cabinetry/appliances present; bathroom fixtures present; bedrooms largely unfurnished (no beds), living/dining furniture mostly absent/minimal.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clean and readable with consistent materials; interior visibility is good. Some areas are sparse and a few details (balcony/exterior edge conditions) are visually ambiguous.

detected_errors.description: Balcony at the lounge side is unclear/possibly missing as a distinct exterior space compared to the 2D plan.
Some door/opening geometries and proportions appear simplified or slightly inconsistent with the 2D plan.
Major furniture (beds/sofa/dining set) is largely missing, reducing room identity confirmation.

summary: A true, clean isometric cutaway 3D conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, but with minor opening inconsistencies and an ambiguous/missing balcony plus sparse furniture.
